abstracts.cdata!:
The Minas Gerais State Privatization
            Project's main objective is to support the state's
            privatization and concession program, making the state
            government less vulnerable to losses on banking operations
            and more efficient in the delivery of gas and highway
            maintenance services.  The project will also support social
            sector grants to mitigate the social costs of adjustment, as
            well as high priority road and school maintenance and
            rehabilitation work to ensure that these physical assets do
            not deteriorate during the adjustment period.  The
            components of this project are (i) privatization of the
            state banks (Banco de Credito Real de Minas Gerais S. A. -
            CREDIREAL and Banco de Estado de Minas Gerais - BEMGE); (ii)
            sale and concessioning of Companhia Estadual de Gas de Minas
            Gerais - GASMIG); (iii) concessioning of two segments of
            state roads with a total of 460 kilometers; (iv)
            establishment of an adequate regulatory framework for the
            private provision of public services; and (v) fiscal
            performance consistent with the capital spending program and
            fiscal indicators cited in the state's Privatization
            Program Letter.
